0.title: Govt releases guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination of 12-14 age group
0.article_body: The Centre released guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination of children in the 12-14 age group, which begins from March 16, stating that only the Corbevax vaccine would be administered to them. Two doses of Corbevax would be administered at an interval of 28 days. Vaccination can be availed through online registration (beginning 9 am on March 16) or through onsite walk-in.

1.title: Our batters need to step up in last innings against Australia: Hasan Ali
1.article_body: Pakistan pacer Hasan Ali has said that their batters will "have to take responsibility in the last innings" in order to make a comeback in the second Test against Australia. Pakistan made 148 runs in their first innings which gave Australia a lead of 408 runs. Ali also added that the Australian pacers bowled "quicker" than Pakistan speedsters.

2.title: 7 Indian players including Vihari, Easwaran to feature in DPL 2022
2.article_body: Seven Indian cricketers including Hanuma Vihari and Abhimanyu Easwaran will be participating in the Dhaka Premier League (DPL). Notably, these seven players went unsold at the IPL mega auction and will now feature in the tournament scheduled to start from Tuesday. All ten clubs participating in the DPL are allowed to field one overseas player.

3.title: Suryakumar likely to miss MI's IPL 2022 opener vs DC: Reports
3.article_body: Mumbai Indians batter Suryakumar Yadav will reportedly miss his side's IPL 2022 opener against Delhi Capitals on March 27 at the Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai. The 31-year-old is yet to recover from a hairline fracture on his thumb sustained during T20I series against West Indies last month. He was subsequently ruled out of following T20I series against Sri Lanka.

4.title: Nearly 6,000 MSMEs got shut down during FY21 and FY22: Govt
4.article_body: Minister of State for MSMEs Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma on Monday said 5,907 MSMEs got shut down in FY21 and FY22. In FY21, 330 MSMEs got shut down, which increased nearly 17-fold in FY22 to 5,577 MSMEs. Maharashtra topped the chart with 1,608 MSME shutdowns, followed by 527 in Bihar, 521 in Tamil Nadu and 442 in Uttar Pradesh.

5.title: Central Vista Avenue revamp work may end by May: Centre
5.article_body: Union Minister of State, Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore told Rajya Sabha that the Central Vista Avenue revamp work might end by May 2022. The redevelopment of Central Vista Avenue was initially due to be completed by Republic Day. Central Public Works Department (CPWD) is also repairing damage caused during Republic Day parade preparations, officials said.

6.title: EU leaders to travel to Kyiv in show of support for Ukraine
6.article_body: The leaders of Poland, Czech Republic and Slovenia will travel to Kyiv on Tuesday to show support for Ukraine amid Russia's attack. The aim is to express the European Union's unequivocal support for Ukraine and its freedom and independence, said Czech PM Petr Fiala, who will be accompanied by Slovenia PM Janez Jansa and Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki.

7.title: Ashwin loves challenges, he wants to find answer for everything: Irfan Pathan
7.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised Ravichandran Ashwin, stating that the off-spinner loves challenges and wants to find an answer for everything. Irfan added, "I feel if Ashwin gets an easy thing, he will want to make it more difficult." He further said, "Ashwin got wickets with difficulties [against Sri Lanka] but he would have got satisfaction from that."

8.title: Shane Watson appointed assistant coach of Delhi Capitals
8.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has been named the new assistant coach of Delhi Capitals (DC) for the upcoming season of IPL. Speaking on his appointment, Watson said, "IPL is the best T20 tournament in the world...I have got incredible memories as a player, and now coaching opportunities...I am really excited."

9.title: Elon Musk's Starlink app becomes most-downloaded in Ukraine: Report
9.article_body: Elon Musk-owned Starlink's app was the most-downloaded app in Ukraine on Monday afternoon after reaching the top spot on Sunday, media reports said. Sensor Tower said the app was downloaded 21,000 times globally Sunday across Apple and Google app stores, of which most downloads came from Ukraine. It has been downloaded nearly 1,00,000 times in Ukraine according to Sensor Tower.

10.title: Dress code should be followed in schools: Hema Malini on hijab ban
10.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini on Tuesday reacted to the hijab issue and said dress code should be followed in schools and religion shouldn't be dragged in it. She further said that there is no need to impose a new ban on hijab in other institutions or working places. Karnataka HC upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.

11.title: Is there any policy to regulate illegal food joints?: HC to BMC
11.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Monday asked BMC if there's a policy to regulate eateries and food outlets, which don't have required licenses but operate through food delivery companies. The Indian Hotel & Restaurant Association filed a plea, claiming that apps picked up food from these eateries, operating from home. These eateries violate the Mumbai Municipal Corporation Act, it added.

12.title: Dog seen carrying head of baby in Hyderabad, police look for body
12.article_body: A stray dog was seen carrying the head of a baby on the streets in Hyderabad on Sunday. When the locals chased the dog, it left the head in the bush. Police sent the head for autopsy and are looking for the body of the baby. Police are scanning CCTV footage to find out where the dog got the head.

13.title: Trying to see how to be best mom to you: Anushka shares post for daughter
13.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma on Monday took to Instagram Stories to share a post for her daughter Vamika. The post read, "Dear child, I spend so much time trying to figure out how to be the best mother to you. I know I won't always get it right." Anushka gave birth to her daughter with Virat Kohli in January last year.

14.title: Cong leadership in 'cuckoo land', going downhill since 2014: Sibal
14.article_body: Congress leader Kapil Sibal on Tuesday said that the party's leadership is "living in cuckoo land" and has been "going downhill" since 2014. "We have suffered humiliating defeats from time to time," he said. Sibal further said that Congress could not connect with the electorate and has been unable to lead from the front and reach out to people.

15.title: Tough task to stick to Ambedkar's mission in the 'age of flattery': Mayawati
15.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati said that it is a tough task to stick to the mission of Babasaheb Ambedkar in this "age of flattery" and asserted that her party, through its movement, is taking this mission forward. Speaking on the occasion of the birth anniversary of BSP founder Kanshi Ram, she said, BSP gave a new dimension to the country's politics.

16.title: Cong should expel me: Ex-U'khand CM Rawat on ticket selling allegations
16.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM and Congress leader Harish Rawat on Tuesday said that the party should expel him if the allegations of ticket selling in Assembly polls against him are proven true. "The allegation of selling posts and party tickets is very serious," he added. "'Harish Rawat evil' should also be burnt by Congress in this Holi," Rawat further said.

17.title: Paytm says RBI order on Paytm Payments Bank 'won't impact overall business'
17.article_body: After RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers, its parent company, One 97 Communications, in a stock exchange filing on Tuesday said that the measure "will not materially impact Paytm’s overall business." On Monday, Paytm Payments Bank also dismissed a report that claimed that RBI’s action was taken as the bank was sharing information with China-based entities.

18.title: I declined 'huge' movie offers due to kissing scenes: Amrita Rao
18.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao has revealed that she declined "huge" movie offers only because she wasn't comfortable doing kissing and lovemaking sequences on screen. "I regret not doing some movies but I had no one experienced to advise me back then," added Amrita. "However, by and large, the movies that I chose to do have been successful...and relevant," stated Amrita.

19.title: China to divert flights away from Shanghai amid COVID-19 surge
19.article_body: China has decided to redirect several international flights from Shanghai airport to other cities from March 21 to May 1 in the wake of COVID-19 surge in the city, said the government. Over 100 flights of five Chinese airlines will reportedly be diverted. A partial lockdown has been imposed in Shanghai to check the spread of the virus.

20.title: BJP MPs' kids didn't get tickets in recent state polls because of me: PM Modi
20.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that many BJP MPs and leaders were seeking poll tickets for their children in the recently-concluded Assembly elections but were denied the same. He said that the tickets were denied as granting them would come under "dynastic politics", adding, "They did not get tickets because of me."

21.title: 67-yr-old Asian woman punched 125 times in the head and face, spat at in US
21.article_body: A 67-yr-old Asian woman was punched more than 125 times in the head and face, spat at and called an "Asian b**ch" by a 42-year-old in New York. Police identified the suspect Tammel Esco on Monday and charged him with attempt to murder and assault for the attack that was caught on surveillance video. The woman suffered facial bone fractures.

22.title: I will make India's first NFT crowdfunded film: Vishal Malhotra
22.article_body: Actor Vishal Malhotra has stated that he will turn a filmmaker by making India's first NFT (Non-Fungible Token) crowdfunded film. "I decided that I wanted to merge the two main interests that I have, films and NFTs. I...thought why not create funding by selling the NFTs and from that money we make a film," Vishal added.

23.title: Important to continue playing in WC like we did against WI: Harmanpreet
23.article_body: Ahead of India-England 2022 Women's World Cup match, India vice-captain Harmanpreet Kaur said it's important for her side to repeat their performance in the win against West Indies in the upcoming matches. India had defeated West Indies by 155 runs, with Smriti Mandhana (123) and Harmanpreet (109) being the top-scorers. India will play England on Wednesday.

24.title: Pakistan's Bazaar raises $70 mn in nation's second-biggest funding
24.article_body: Pakistan-based e-commerce startup Bazaar has raised $70 million in funding, making it the nation's second-largest funding round. The round was led by Dragoneer Investment Group and Tiger Global Management. Pakistani startups raised more than $350 million last year, greater than the amount over the previous six years combined. Bazaar operates in 21 cities across Pakistan.

25.title: Pune Metro may increase train frequency on Garware College-Vanaz route
25.article_body: Maha Metro is planning to increase the frequency of trains between Garware College and Vanaz amid growing footfall of passengers. Maha Metro said it'll also reduce the gap between two trains from the present half an hour to 15 minutes. When the metro will reach up to Shivajinagar in June, the wait time will be reduced to five minutes.

26.title: 300% rise in bookings for one-way flights out of Hong Kong amid COVID-19 cases
26.article_body: Demand for flights leaving Hong Kong surged 306% as compared to the same time last year amid talks of mass COVID-19 testing and lockdowns. A "steep rise" in outbound bookings from January 4 to March 7 has been observed. About half of Hong Kong's 7.4 million people have already been infected with COVID-19 following the omicron wave, a study claimed.

27.title: If PSL uses auction model, we will see who goes to play in IPL over PSL: Ramiz Raja
27.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja has said that he wants to switch Pakistan Super League (PSL) to the auction model from the current draft system. "If we take PSL to auction model, increase the purse, then I'll put it in IPL bracket. And then we'll see who goes to play the IPL over the PSL," he added.

28.title: Billionaire's 31-yr-old son killed by boat propeller while trying to save fiancée in US
28.article_body: Juan Carlos Escotet Alviarez, the 31-year-old son of a Venezuelan banking billionaire, died while trying to save his fiancée during a fishing competition in Florida, US over the weekend. Alviarez dived into the water to save his fiancée after she fell off the boat. After entering the water, Alviarez was struck by a boat propeller and died from his injuries.

29.title: Why is Kapil Sibal speaking RSS, BJP's language: Cong MP Manickam
29.article_body: Congress MP Manickam Tagore on Tuesday questioned party leader Kapil Sibal over his remarks against the party leadership, saying, "Why [is Sibal] speaking...language of RSS/BJP?" Sibal in an interview said that the party leadership is "living in cuckoo land". Tagore also claimed that RSS and BJP want "Nehru-Gandhi's" out of Congress leadership as then the party will become "Janata party".

30.title: Radicon Vedantam's Greater Noida office sealed for non-payment to homebuyers
30.article_body: The office of realty firm Radicon Vedantam in Greater Noida's Sector 16C has been sealed for failing to pay ₹4 crore to homebuyers. "We'll seal the offices of other realty firms tomorrow if they don't clear homebuyers' payments,” said VP Mishra, Tehsildar of Dadri. Properties of different developers are likely to be auctioned too for failing to hand over possession.

31.title: Actress Amrita Rao shares pics of secret wedding for 1st time after 8 years
31.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao and RJ Anmol have for the first time shared pictures from their secret wedding, that took place in 2014. "The news of my wedding could have hampered my career prospects which, luckily, Anmol understood," she said while speaking about their secret wedding. "However, getting married at the right time was also important," Amrita added.

32.title: My dream is to make an electric highway from Delhi to Jaipur: Gadkari
32.article_body: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said his dream is to make India's first electric highway between Delhi and Jaipur. He said the market is ready to support his ministry's initiative. He added that the government has so far received 47 proposals to set up ropeway cables in Manipur, Sikkim, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh and Kashmir.

33.title: I'll talk to Kohli about coming back to academy: Childhood coach Rajkumar
33.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said he would ask the 33-year-old to come back to the academy to work on his basics. "He's batting well but unfortunately, he's batting too cautiously. If [he] starts to bat a bit more freely, he will be back to his best," he added. Virat last scored an international century in November 2019.

34.title: Rahul is not the party president but he takes all decisions: Kapil Sibal
34.article_body: Speaking on the faction of Congress leaders demanding re-appointment of Rahul Gandhi as party's president, senior Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that he is not the president of the party, but he takes all the decisions. "He is already the de-facto president. So why are they asking him that he should take back the reins of power," Sibal further added.

35.title: Japanese billionaire who flew to space buys robotics startup Groove X
35.article_body: Japanese billionaire Yusaku Maezawa-owned fund has acquired a majority stake in robotics startup Groove X and will move to full ownership in April. The startup's product 'Lovot', an amalgam of "love" and "robot", has wheels and resembles a penguin with cartoonish human eyes, and communicates in squeaks. Maezawa spent 12 days on the International Space Station last year.

36.title: K'taka hijab case petitioners to approach Supreme Court as HC upholds ban
36.article_body: After Karnataka High Court dismissed writ petitions filed by Muslim girl students seeking permission to wear hijab in colleges, a Supreme Court lawyer announced that the students from Udupi have decided to approach the top court. "These girls will...continue their education while exercising their rights to wear hijab...They have not lost hope in courts and Constitution," the advocate tweeted.

37.title: Faced problems during the shoot; no one stood by us: 'The Kashmir...' producer
37.article_body: Speaking about 'The Kashmir Files', film's producer Abhishek Agarwal, said he never expected the movie to do so well. "It has become people's film," he added. Abhishek said they did everything by themselves for three and a half years to make the movie. "There were...many problems during the shoot of the film but no one stood with us," he added.

38.title: People have lost patience: 'Valimai' director on negative reviews
38.article_body: Director H Vinoth, speaking about the negative reviews for his recently released film 'Valimai' starring Ajith Kumar, said that the audience was not "psychologically ready" when the film's fast-paced narration was slowed down in the second half. "This generation's audience is the restless people who are used to seeing YouTube shorts. They have lost their patience," he added.

39.title: PMC chief to take over as administrator of civic body as polls delayed
39.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) Commissioner Vikram Kumar is set to take over as administrator of the civic body as PMC's five-year term ended on Monday. The decision came as civic body elections have been postponed in the state. Neighbouring Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation's (PCMC) Commissioner Rajesh Patil also took charge as PCMC's administrator as its term concluded on Sunday.

40.title: 3 held for cloning bank cards of customers at fuel station in Noida
40.article_body: Three men working at a fuel station in Noida were arrested by the Gautam Buddha Nagar Police for allegedly cloning debit and credit cards of customers to siphon off funds from their accounts. After stealing customers' data, the gang would make cloned cards. The gang would then use these cards to withdraw money from customers' bank accounts in other cities.

41.title: Supertech's Noida twin towers to be demolished in 9 secs using over 2,500 kg explosives
41.article_body: Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in Noida's Sector 93A will be demolished in nine seconds on May 22 using explosives, said officials. The demolition ordered by Supreme Court will require around 2,500-4,000 kg of explosives, which will be loaded into the structure in 12-15 days. Around 1,500 households in the vicinity will be moved out for around five hours that day.

42.title: European Space Agency selects Thales-led team to make oxygen on Moon
42.article_body: An industrial team led by UK-based Thales Alenia Space has been chosen by the European Space Agency (ESA) to design and build an experimental payload to extract oxygen on the Moon. They would develop a small solar-powered prototype device that will evaluate the prospect of building larger oxygen plants to extract breathable air for astronauts from the lunar soil.

43.title: Doctor assaults patient with wooden stick at Odisha hospital
43.article_body: A video of a doctor assaulting a patient with a wooden stick at the Dharamgarh sub-divisional hospital in Odisha's Kalahandi district has gone viral. The patient, a resident of Dharamgarh's Bastipada, had gone to the hospital with a complaint of stomach ache. "Instead of taking care of my pain, the doctor misbehaved with me...started beating," the patient said.

44.title: I was not bothered about missing out on a hundred: Shreyas Iyer
44.article_body: Talking about his consecutive half-centuries in India's second Test against Sri Lanka, Shreyas Iyer said, "When I saw other batters struggling, I knew I had to attack." "I wasn't too bothered about missing out on a hundred," added Shreyas. "We were given a target and I was in the mindset to play as many balls as possible," stated Shreyas.

45.title: Russia says it will bring back US astronaut from space amid tensions over war
45.article_body: Amid tensions due to war with Ukraine, Russian space agency Roscosmos has said it would bring back US astronaut Mark Vande Hei from the International Space Station on board Russia's space capsule vehicle as scheduled. This comes after reports claimed that Russia was threatening to strand the American astronaut on the ISS in direct response to US' sanctions on Russia.

46.title: I was not cut out to be a 90s hero, couldn't be 'dhinchak': Ayub Khan
46.article_body: Actor Ayub Khan said he "wasn't cut out to be the 90s hero". "I think I was...a little too awkward. I don't think...I fit in to what the heroes catered to back then...I couldn't be all dhinchak...But now, I think I am game for it...fix my greys and I will do it," the 'Ranju Ki Betiyaan' actor said.

47.title: 51.5% postal ballot votes cast in favour of SP alliance: Akhilesh Yadav
47.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday claimed that over half of postal ballot votes in the UP assembly elections were cast in favour of the SP alliance. "The SP alliance got 51.5% of postal ballot votes...according to that the alliance would have won 304 seats," Akhilesh tweeted. "People in government remember, you won't get strength by deceiving," he added.

48.title: Character certificates must for delivery service employees in Mumbai
48.article_body: The Mumbai Police has made it mandatory for those employed in delivery services to have character certificates. The document is issued to certify whether someone has a criminal record against them or not. In a circular issued, Commissioner Sanjay Pandey said the decision was taken after several citizens filed complaints, including that of robbery, against delivery service employees.

49.title: I welcome K'taka HC's hijab verdict, students must follow rules: NCW chairperson
49.article_body: National Commission for Women (NCW) chairperson Rekha Sharma on Tuesday welcomed the Karnataka HC's verdict on the hijab controversy. "It is firstly not a religious practice, as per Quran. Secondly, when a student enters an institute, they must follow the rules and regulations," Sharma added. Karnataka HC on Tuesday upheld hijab ban in colleges.

50.title: No decision on NRIC at national level yet: MoS Home Nityanand Rai
50.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) Home Nityanand Rai in the Parliament on Tuesday stated that the government hasn't "taken any decision to prepare the NRIC (National Register of Indian Citizens)" at the national level. Responding to a Parliamentary question, Rai further said that the "supplementary list of inclusions and the list of exclusions for NRC, Assam have been published on 31/08/2019".

51.title: Reliance buys assets of battery maker Lithium Werks for ₹467 cr
51.article_body: Reliance Industries has acquired the assets of battery maker Lithium Werks for ₹467 crore through its subsidiary Reliance New Energy. The acquired assets include Lithium Werks' portfolio of about 219 patents, a manufacturing facility in China, key business contracts and existing employees. Earlier in December, Reliance agreed to buy UK-based sodium-ion battery company Faradion for ₹1,000 crore.

52.title: PMC budget proposes to develop Pune as a lake & yoga city
52.article_body: The final budget presented by the standing committee of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Monday has proposed to make Pune a lake and yoga city. It has also proposed pedestrian-friendly signals with timers and mobile clinics for senior citizens among other schemes. The committee's Chairman, Hemant Rasane, presented the final budget of ₹9,716 crore for the year 2022-23.

53.title: Those who talk of freedom of expression trying to discredit 'The Kashmir Files': PM
53.article_body: Talking about 'The Kashmir Files' during the BJP Parliamentary meeting, PM Narendra Modi said, "People who always raise flags of freedom of expression have been freaking out since the last five-six days." He added, "Instead of discussing the film factually, there's a campaign to discredit it." The movie is based on the exodus of Hindus from Kashmir Valley in 1990.

54.title: Pizza topping is not pizza, it'll attract 18% GST: Haryana appellate authority
54.article_body: A pizza topping is not pizza and hence it should attract a higher GST of 18%, the Haryana Appellate Authority for Advance Ruling (AAAR) stated in a recent ruling. It noted that a pizza topping can't be classified as "processed cheese" because it has other ingredients like vegetable oil. Pizza topping would merit classification as "food preparation", the authority said.

55.title: He made it very comfortable: Shruti Seth on intimate scene with Jaideep
55.article_body: Actress Shruti Seth, who'll play Jaideep Ahlawat's on-screen wife in the upcoming show 'Bloody Brothers', shared her experience of working with the actor. "Jaideep is a dream to work with," she said. "Just watching him perform is a masterclass for any actor. He's wonderful on-screen and even more wonderful off-screen. He made the whole intimacy scene so comfortable," Shruti added.

56.title: All COVID-19 curbs lifted in Punjab with immediate effect
56.article_body: The Department of Home Affairs and Justice of the Punjab government issued an order on Tuesday, saying that all restrictions imposed in the state due to COVID-19 have been lifted with immediate effect. "However, the residents of the state are advised to follow COVID-19 appropriate behavioural norms," the order read. On Monday, Punjab had reported 48 new COVID-19 cases.

57.title: Russia sees 2,088% spike in VPN demand after Instagram, Facebook ban
57.article_body: The demand for tools to evade the restrictions on social media apps has skyrocketed in Russia after the country banned Meta-owned social media apps, Facebook and Instagram. On the eve of the Instagram ban, demand for Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) in Russia spiked 2,088% higher than the daily average demand in mid-February. Instagram was banned by Russia on Sunday midnight.

58.title: Publicity stunt, shame on you: Hacker group Anonymous as Musk dares Putin to fight
58.article_body: Hacker group Anonymous criticised the world's richest man and Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin for a "single combat" and said that stakes would be Ukraine. Anonymous tweeted, "Elon has no authority regarding the legal status of statehood and sovereignty of Ukraine. People are suffering, innocents are being killed...Elon pushes publicity stunt. Shame on you."

59.title: Don't have fancy six-pack abs, they're old fashioned: Rahul on transformation
59.article_body: Speaking about his physical transformation, singer Rahul Vaidya said that he started with a disciplined routine, a healthy diet and a workout regime. "With a combination of these three, I got here within four months," he added. "I am not a person who believes in abs. I don't fancy a six-pack, it is too old fashioned," Rahul said.

60.title: First to start quarantine, hopefully the last to leave: Plessis
60.article_body: RCB's newly appointed captain Faf du Plessis has entered a three-day quarantine ahead of the IPL season, wishing for a long run in the tournament. "Hopefully it's first in and last out, at the end of the tournament," Faf stated. "[I'll do] a bit of training in room...because your body isn't meant to just lie on a bed," he added.

61.title: BJP MLA lying, no restrictions on Kashmir Files: Chhattisgarh Cong
61.article_body: Chhattisgarh Congress spokesperson Sushil Anand Shukla has accused BJP MLA Brijmohan Agrawal of "lying" and dismissed the latter's allegations of "restrictions imposed" on the screening of 'The Kashmir Files' in Chhattisgarh. "The situation (exodus of Kashmiri Pandits) arose in the country when VP Singh was PM and BJP was supporting him. Also, J&K Governor was a BJP leader," Shukla added.

62.title: 5-yr-old UP boy electrocuted to death after kite string cuts wire
62.article_body: A five-year-old boy was electrocuted to death after a kite string he was playing with cut a live electrical wire, which then fell on him, in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. The boy had been playing in the courtyard when the kite string got entangled with the wire. The boy was then rushed to a doctor where he was declared dead.

63.title: Revenue employee found dead in Tahsildar’s office in Telangana
63.article_body: A Village Revenue Assistant (VRA) was found dead in the Tahsildar’s office premises in Mancherial district, Telangana on Monday, police said. According to a police official, the deceased, Durgam Bapu (55), was "suspected to have been murdered by some unidentified persons". The reasons for the murder were being ascertained and a case of murder has been registered, police said.

64.title: Didn't even have walls: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri on ancestral home
64.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri, while sharing an old newspaper clip, tweeted, "This is our ancestral house where I grew up. We had nothing. Not even walls." "But my grandfather made us worship Saraswati and my father went on to become vice chancellor and translated all Kalidas & Vedas. It's because of Saraswati, I could make #TheKashmirFiles," he added.

65.title: UK's Arm to fire 1,000 staff after $40 bn sale to Nvidia collapses
65.article_body: UK-based chipmaker Arm will lay off up to 15% of its workforce in the UK and the US, CEO Rene Haas said in a memo to staff. The development comes over a month after the collapse of its proposed sale to US rival Nvidia for $40 billion. The layoffs will affect about 1,000 employees, but will reportedly not affect engineers.

66.title: Kerala temple disallows artist to perform after his son marries Muslim woman
66.article_body: Temple committee of Kerala's Karivelloor Kaniyan Parembethu Bhagathy temple has decided not to allow a ritual to be performed by an artist during a festival after his son married a Muslim woman. The artist, Vinod Panicker, said, "I am a Poorakali artist and have been doing this for 37 years." I have never experienced this sort of humiliation, he added.

67.title: Pune's Rajiv Gandhi zoo to reopen after 2 years on March 20
67.article_body: Pune's Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park is set to reopen on March 20, two years after it was closed amid the pandemic. Director Rajkumar Jadhav said that people need to be fully vaccinated and carry their coronavirus vaccination certificate for entry. "People will get to see 63 species including the Shekru (Indian Giant Squirrel) and wild cats' enclosures," he added.

68.title: UN rights chief condemns execution of 81 people in a day in Saudi
68.article_body: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Michelle Bachelet has condemned the mass execution of 81 people carried out in a single day in Saudi Arabia. She alleged that some of those executed were sentenced to death without a fair trial and due process. She called for bringing "the country's counterterrorism laws fully into line with international standards".

69.title: Don't know how court has given this verdict: K'taka Congress MP on hijab verdict
69.article_body: Following Karnataka HC's verdict on the hijab controversy, Karnataka Congress MP DK Suresh said the government has to give "protection" to all girl students. "Islam practice is accepted by the Constitution, don't know how the court has given this verdict," Suresh added. "Petitions have been rejected but customs continue," Suresh stated. Karnataka HC on Tuesday upheld hijab ban in colleges.

70.title: Pak to deploy paramilitary forces in capital ahead of no-confidence motion against PM
70.article_body: The Pakistan government has decided to deploy paramilitary forces in capital Islamabad ahead of the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan. The country's Interior Ministry has reportedly notified the Cabinet about the deployment of at least 1,000 paramilitary personnel. The opposition Pakistan Democratic Movement (PDM) has called for a protest march against the government on March 23.

71.title: CM Yogi Adityanath declares film 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in UP
71.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath took to Twitter to announce that Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' has been made tax-free in the state. The film has now been made tax-free in several other BJP-ruled states, including Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Tripura, Goa, Karnataka, Uttarakhand and Haryana. The film depicts the mass exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the state.

72.title: Reliance is acting outside the litigation & taking over stores: Future to Supreme Court
72.article_body: Amid the legal dispute with Amazon, Future Retail told the Supreme Court, "Reliance is acting outside the litigation. Reliance is taking over [stores]...We can't do anything." "Not one store has been surrendered. Reliance took away the boards as they're entitled to...our assets are where they are," it said. Landlords terminated stores' leases after Future didn't pay rents, the company added.

73.title: 'The Kashmir Files' is a wound that can never be healed: Anupam Kher
73.article_body: Talking about his movie 'The Kashmir Files' which has been directed by Vivek Agnihotri, actor Anupam Kher said, "It is not a film but a wound that can never be healed." "The film is about knocking on the soul of every Indian," added Anupam. "There has been no trial, no one has been punished," stated Anupam.

74.title: 283 Asiatic lions died in two years: Gujarat minister
74.article_body: As many as 283 Asiatic lions have died over the last two years, the Gujarat government told the state assembly. In response to questions in the House, Forest and Environment Minister, Kiritsinh Jitubha Rana, said that 159 deaths were reported in 2020 and 124 in 2021. Rana said the 283 included 68 lions, 73 lionesses and 142 cubs.

75.title: Will try to win hearts of misguided girl students: K'taka Minister on hijab verdict
75.article_body: After Karnataka High Court upheld hijab ban inside educational institutions, state Primary and Secondary Education Minister BC Nagesh said, "We'll try to win the hearts of those girls who were misguided." "I have faith that they will come to college and continue their education because people of Karnataka neither speak against the court verdict nor go against it," Nagesh added.

76.title: People on the sets are told not to go near me: Shefali Shah
76.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said, "Everyone feels I am very intimidating. I have heard stories that when I am on the sets, people on the sets are told not to go near me." "This is what the directors tell their team," added Shefali. Shefali will be seen starring alongside actress Vidya Balan in their upcoming movie 'Jalsa'.

77.title: Vidya is very confident in her space, I'm burdened with self-doubt: Shefali
77.article_body: On being asked about a quality of Vidya Balan which she didn't expect her 'Jalsa' co-star to have, Shefali Shah said, "She is very confident in her space." Shefali added, "She is comfortable and confident about who she is without any arrogance and ego to it." "I am burdened with self-doubt all the time," she further said.

78.title: Several Haryana Cong, BJP leaders added to AAP by Satyendar Jain
78.article_body: Several politicians formerly attached with the Congress and BJP in Haryana joined AAP in the presence of Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Monday. The list includes ex-minister, ex-MLAs and some former independent candidates as well. Some notable politicians among them are Balbir Singh Saini, Bijendra Singh, Brahm Singh Gurjar, Kamal Singh Tanwar and Amandeep Singh Waraich.

79.title: Dengue cases fell drastically during COVID lockdown: Lancet study
79.article_body: Dengue cases across the globe fell drastically during the COVID-19 lockdown, a Lancet study has found. The study estimated that 7,20,000 fewer dengue cases were reported worldwide in 2020 as public places were shut following the restrictions imposed by government and local authorities to contain the spread of coronavirus. The data was collected from 23 countries spanning dengue-endemic regions.

80.title: Minor boy sexually assaulted by 'chacha' he met online in Pune
80.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was allegedly sexually assaulted by a man, who identified himself as 'chacha' (uncle), whom he met online in Pune. The boy's mother alleged in the FIR that the "accused had come to their home when the boy was alone on March 9" when the crime was committed. The police are on the lookout for the accused.

81.title: I launched it 6 months ago: Ashneer day after BharatPe unveils gold loan services
81.article_body: After BharatPe launched gold loan services for merchant partners, its former founder Ashneer Grover accused CEO Suhail Sameer of taking credit for his segment. He said, "The Gold Loan business was launched by me and Nikhilesh 6 months back...Suhail had no contribution...and is selling lies as he hasn't been able to launch...things which I had planned in last 3 months."

82.title: HC refuses to direct Nawab Malik's release in money laundering case
82.article_body: Bombay HC has refused to direct Nawab Malik's release in the alleged money laundering case. "As certain debatable issues are raised, they require to be heard at length...not inclined to allow the prayers in the interim application. Interim applications rejected," HC said. Malik was arrested by ED on February 23 over an alleged money laundering case linked to Dawood Ibrahim.

83.title: Didn't assess conditions that well: Taylor on 2nd straight loss in Women's WC
83.article_body: West Indies Women captain Stafanie Taylor has said they "didn't assess the conditions that well" in their seven-wicket loss against Australia in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup. It was West Indies' second defeat in a row in the tournament. "We still have three games left. We have to leave this behind us," she stated.

84.title: PM Modi, Amit Shah never felt a Bengali can be made cabinet Minister: Supriyo
84.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo said on Monday that PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah never felt a Bengali could be made a Union cabinet minister. The parties of north India have always neglected Bengalis, he added. Supriyo's remark came after the TMC declared him as its candidate in the Assembly by-election from Ballygunge seat.

85.title: Maha auto-rickshaw driver gets 7 yrs jail for kidnapping & raping 17-yr-old
85.article_body: A court in Maharashtra sentenced a 33-year-old auto-rickshaw driver to 7 years' rigorous imprisonment for kidnapping and raping a 17-year-old girl. The accused allegedly kidnapped the girl in December 2017 and took her to Bhadohi in Uttar Pradesh. He raped her repeatedly until March 2018. He was, later, booked as her parents had registered a kidnapping complaint with the police.

86.title: Man says new mazar built in Delhi; locals say 'It's been there for 40 yrs'
86.article_body: A man, in a viral video, said a mazar (Islamic shrine) has been constructed in Delhi's Civil Lines area and it would lead to a larger mosque being built that would turn into major "election issue". Meanwhile, locals said structure has been there for at least 40 years. DCP's office confirmed no new construction has taken place in area.

87.title: First passenger train engine arrives at Manipur's Khongsang railway station
87.article_body: The first passenger train engine arrived at the newly constructed Khongsang railway station in the Noney district of Manipur on Monday, as part of a trial run. The engine covered a distance of 62 km from Jiribam to Khongsang. Caretaker Chief Minister N Biren Singh tweeted a video of women performing a traditional dance to welcome the engine.

88.title: B'luru to get integrated command and control centre for service delivery
88.article_body: Bengaluru Smart City Ltd (BSCL) will set up an Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) at BBMP headquarters. The platform will be integrated with 14 government departments for service delivery and will go live in another 100 days. According to BSCL MD Rajendra Cholan, information from all the departments will be collected and analysed for better planning of the city.

89.title: Apple releases iOS 15.4 update allowing use of Face ID unlock with masks
89.article_body: Apple has released its iOS 15.4 update that will allow users to use Face ID unlock on their devices with face masks on. The feature will be available on iPhone 12 and iPhone 13 series. Apple says the feature scans unique features around the eye area to authenticate. Other improvements in the update include safety messages during AirTag setup.

90.title: Fan edit compares Anupam's 'The Kashmir…' performance with Joker, actor reacts
90.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Anupam Kher shared a collage of Joker actor Heath ledger and his character in 'The Kashmir Files'. The photo has a text written over it that reads, 'performances that world will never forget!' He captioned it, "Anonymous compliments are the best...Thank you my anonymous friend for making this. I am delighted to see it!! #TheKashmirFiles."

91.title: Disagree with Karnataka HC judgement on hijab: Asaduddin Owaisi
91.article_body: Lok Sabha MP Asaduddin Owaisi has said that he "disagrees with Karnataka High Court's judgement" which upheld the ban on wearing hijab in the state's educational institutions. Owaisi tweeted, "It's my right to disagree with the judgement and I hope that petitioners appeal before Supreme Court." He also said that banning headscarf "prevents devout Muslim women" from accessing education.

92.title: Kapil thanks Anupam Kher for clarifying 'The Kashmir Files' invitation controversy
92.article_body: Kapil Sharma thanked actor Anupam Kher for clarifying 'The Kashmir Files' invitation controversy. Anupam revealed Kapil had invited him but he declined the invitation to Kapil's show as he didn't want to promote the movie in a comedy show. However, Anupam suggested Kapil to not post "half-truth" as reasons given to Vivek Agnihotri for not inviting the team were "different".

93.title: Mumbai Police registers FIR against BJP MLC Pravin Darekar in bank fraud case
93.article_body: A case has been registered against Leader of Opposition in Maharashtra Legislative Council and BJP leader Pravin Yashwant Darekar in connection with an alleged bank fraud case, an official said. The complainant, an AAP functionary, claimed that Darekar posed as a labourer to get directorship at the Mumbai Bank and allegedly indulged in various financial irregularities.

94.title: BJP govt will be formed once again in 2024: Anurag Thakur on Assembly poll results
94.article_body: Following BJP's electoral win in four states, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said blooming "lotus" in four states clearly indicates that in 2024, the BJP government will be formed once again under PM Narendra Modi’s leadership. "I received the opportunity to work as party's co-in charge in UP. It was very clear that the public loves PM Modi-CM Yogi," Thakur added.

95.title: Octopuses are using garbage in ocean including beer cans for shelter: Study
95.article_body: Researchers in Brazil have compiled 261 photos and videos of 24 species of octopuses interacting with human litter on ocean floor. These photos show octopuses using beer cans, plastic and glass bottles, battery and a rusted metal pipe for shelter. Researchers, thus, concluded that human-made trash may be more ubiquitous for octopuses to hide in than natural shelter like seashells.

96.title: Man irritated by regular barking stabs stray dog to death in Delhi
96.article_body: A man stabbed a stray dog to death in Delhi's Kalyanpuri area. The accused has reportedly told the police that the dog used to bark often and that he was irritated by it, which is why, he stabbed the dog. Police said that a case under sections of cruelty on animals has been registered.

97.title: Raj Kundra completely covers his face with hoodie in theatre, gets trolled for outfit
97.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra has been trolled after he arrived at a theatre in Mumbai by completely covering his face with a hoodie. "Trying to be...male version of Kim Kardashian," a user commented. "For a minute I thought it was Ranveer Singh, only he dresses like that," wrote another. "Copying Kanye West's look won’t make you Kanye West," a comment read.

98.title: What is 'stealth Omicron' variant of COVID-19 that is driving cases in China?
98.article_body: The 'stealth Omicron' variant of COVID-19 is the BA.2 lineage of the Omicron variant. Studies have shown that BA.2 has a growth advantage over BA.1, the World Health Organization (WHO) said. Studies are ongoing to understand the reasons for this growth advantage, but initial data suggests that BA.2 appears inherently more transmissible than BA.1, it added.

99.title: 3 crore people under lockdown in China amid worst COVID-19 case surge in 2 years
99.article_body: Nearly 3 crore people were under lockdown across China on Tuesday as it reported 5,280 COVID-19 cases for the first time since the early days of the pandemic. At least 13 cities were fully locked down on Tuesday, and several other cities had partial lockdowns. The case surge is driven by 'stealth Omicron' variant or the BA.2 sub-variant, reports said.

100.title: Channi cannot be mascot of Punjab Congress anymore: Sunil Jakhar
100.article_body: Following the Congress' defeat in Punjab Assembly polls, former state Congress chief Sunil Jakhar said that Congress' Charanjit Singh Channi cannot be the "mascot" of Punjab Congress anymore. "He has been removed by people. Look at the percentage of votes...We have Sangrur Lok Sabha by-election. Then we will have municipal elections. We will have to galvanise workers," Jakhar added.

101.title: 7 people arrested after 19 headless cow carcasses found in Punjab
101.article_body: Seven people, including two women, were arrested on Monday after at least 19 headless cow carcasses were found at an abandoned place near a railway track last week in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. Police also recovered a hammer, three knives, two sickles, two choppers and three sharp bodkins from the accused. One of the accused has five other cases filed against him.

102.title: Which states/UTs arrested the highest number of people under UAPA in 2020?
102.article_body: Uttar Pradesh arrested the highest number of people at 361 under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967, in the year 2020, followed by Jammu & Kashmir (346) and Manipur (225), according to the Central government. Tamil Nadu arrested 92 people, while 69 people were arrested in Jharkhand. Tamil Nadu acquitted the highest number of people at 50.

103.title: There's openness being seen in Rohit's captaincy, statements: Saba Karim
103.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Saba Karim has said there's a lot of openness being seen in Rohit Sharma's captaincy and statements. "I feel the synergy of Rohit and Rahul Dravid is working to a large extent...[but] they'll have to prove this synergy even better [away from home]," he added. Rohit led India to a 2-0 win in two-Test series against Sri Lanka.

104.title: BSP changes party leader in Lok Sabha after setback in UP polls
104.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati replaced Ritesh Pandey as the party leader in Lok Sabha with Girish Chandra Jatav. This is the first change in party-related responsibilities after the BSP faced huge setback in Uttar Pradesh assembly polls. "The party will assign Ritesh Pandey some other responsibilities in view of the 2024 Lok Sabha polls," a BSP leader said.

105.title: Helipads set up for Mann's swearing in, 3-4 lakh attendees expected: Report
105.article_body: Ahead of Aam Aadmi Party's Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in ceremony in Punjab, arrangements are being made in Bhagat Singh's village Khatkar Kalan. Reports said that around three to four lakh people are expected to attend the ceremony. Three stages have been set up at the venue. Meanwhile, helipads and parking space for 25,000 cars have also bee set up.

106.title: We're broke, Amazon is driving us to our knees: Future Group to Supreme Court
106.article_body: After Amazon objected to Reliance Industries' takeover of several Future Retail stores, the Kishore Biyani-led group told the Supreme Court, "We are broke, we have no money. Amazon is driving us to the knees." "Rents haven't been paid for 2 years...Landlords terminated leases and we had no money to pay them. Reliance signed up with landlords," Future's lawyer said.

107.title: Complete probe into Anish Khan's death in a month: HC to WB govt
107.article_body: Calcutta High Court on Monday directed the West Bengal government's special investigation team to complete its investigation into the student leader Anish Khan's death within a month. The probe should be completed impartially and without delay, the court added. Khan's father had demanded a CBI probe saying that he has no faith in the state police.

108.title: MakeMyTrip launches limited-edition NFT collection 'Virtual Vacations'
108.article_body: MakeMyTrip has launched its NFT collection, Virtual Vacations, which aims to bring alive the spectacular beauty and diversity of India's myriad landscapes. MakeMyTrip says that each art piece is a kaleidoscopic meta-world view of some of India's most popular tourist spots. In collaboration with KoineArth, the collection comprising NFT arts of 9 Indian states is live on the ngageN platform.

109.title: Rishabh Pant is somebody who can change the game in 40 minutes: Rohit
109.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has praised wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant for his performance in the Tests against Sri Lanka, stating that the 24-year-old can change the game in 40 minutes. "There will be times when you will smash your head and say 'why did he play that shot' but again we need to accept that when he bats," added Rohit.

110.title: Mumbai civic body lists dos and don'ts as IMD predicts severe heatwave conditions
110.article_body: After IMD predicted severe heatwave conditions in Mumbai for Tuesday and Wednesday, the BMC has issued a list of dos and don'ts for citizens. The BMC has asked citizens to avoid strenuous activities, going out in sun, consuming alcohol, tea, coffee and high-protein or stale food. Citizens have been asked to remain hydrated and use umbrellas or hats when outside.

111.title: Deeply disappointing: Mehbooba Mufti on Karnataka HC's hijab verdict
111.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti called the decision of the Karnataka High Court on the hijab controversy "deeply disappointing". Taking to Twitter, Mufti wrote, ''Court's decision to uphold hijab ban is deeply disappointing. On one hand, we talk about empowering women yet we are denying them the right to a simple choice. It isn't just about religion but freedom to choose."

112.title: A brave attempt to show our truth: 'Uri' director on 'The Kashmir Files'
112.article_body: 'Uri' director Aditya Dhar took to Twitter to share his views on Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', a film based on the exodus of the Kashmiri Pandit community from the state. "[It's] a brave attempt to show our TRUTH," he wrote, adding, "Being a filmmaker myself I couldn't have made a better film than this on my own tragedy."

113.title: Spain seizes Russian oligarch's $140 million yacht in Barcelona
113.article_body: Spain has seized a Russian oligarch's yacht with an estimated worth of $140 million in Barcelona, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Monday. "Today we seized - the technical term is provisionally immobilised - a yacht belonging to one of the principal oligarchs," he said. "We are talking about a yacht that we estimate is worth $140 million," he added.

114.title: You're special, you're fabulous: Soni pens poem on daughter Alia's b'day
114.article_body: Actress Soni Razdan has penned a poem on the occasion of her actress-daughter Alia Bhatt's birthday. Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, she shared the poem along with an old picture of Alia. "You're special, you're fabulous, you're super and fantabulous, you're super-cali-fragilous and expi-Alia-docillous. Happy Birthday dearest one, your loving Mama," a part of Soni's poem read.

115.title: Licious raises $150 mn, Zerodha and boAt Founders invest too
115.article_body: D2C meat and seafood brand Licious has raised $150 million led by Amansa Capital, along with Kotak PE and Axis Growth Avenues AIF-I. The funding comes six months after Licious turned unicorn after raising $52 million. Zerodha Founders Nithin and Nikhil Kamath also participated in the funding along with boAt Founder Aman Gupta and True North's Haresh Chawla.

116.title: Delhi PWD identifies 86 spots to install 600 LED screens, invites bids
116.article_body: Delhi Public Works Department (PWD) has identified 86 spots to install 600 LED screens across the city and have invited bids for the same. The estimated cost of the project is ₹475.78 crore and its aim is to inform citizens about the policies and initiatives undertaken by the government. The work is expected to be completed by December 2022.

117.title: Musk shares old fake pic of Putin riding a bear, says he can bring it to fight him
117.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk has shared an old photoshopped picture of Russian President Vladimir Putin riding a bear after challenging him to single combat. In response to Russian space agency Roscosmos' chief Dmitry Rogozin's tweet, Musk wrote, "He can even bring his bear." Earlier, Rogozin quoted a Russian poet's verse to call Musk a "little devil".

118.title: Aamir's ex-wife Reena, 'Andaz Apna...' director attend actor's b'day party
118.article_body: Aamir Khan, who turned 57 on Monday, hosted a get-together for his family and friends at his Mumbai residence. It was attended by his ex-wife Reena Dutta and her parents. 'Andaz Apna Apna' director Rajkumar Santoshi also attended the party with wife and daughter. Aamir's daughter Ira also wished her father by sharing a throwback picture on her Instagram handle.

119.title: The Kashmir Files is a great film; it has washed Bollywood's sins: Kangana
119.article_body: Kangana Ranaut congratulated the team of 'The Kashmir Files' for their success. Sharing her reaction with the paparazzi after stepping out of a theatre, Kangana said, "They've made such a great movie that Bollywood's sins have been washed away." Kangana added people in Bollywood should promote this film. "They make nonsense movies and promote them like anything," she said.

120.title: Airlines not using aerobridges for boarding to save money: Parliament panel
120.article_body: A Parliamentary Committee said that private airlines are choosing not to use aerobridges while boarding and deboarding aircraft to save money and therefore, aged people are bearing the brunt as they have to use stairs. The Committee said that it "deplores this apathetic and unreasonable attitude" and asked the Ministry of Civil Aviation to impose a penalty on such carriers.

121.title: NASA says will continue working with Russian counterpart on space
121.article_body: Even as the US has imposed several sanctions against Russia over Ukraine invasion, space agency NASA has said that it will continue working with its Russian counterpart Roscosmos. "The new export control measures will continue to allow US-Russia civil space cooperation. No changes are planned to the agency's support for ongoing in orbit and ground station operations," said NASA spokesperson.

122.title: Russian state TV's news editor interrupts live broadcast with 'They are lying' sign
122.article_body: An anti-war protestor interrupted a live news bulletin on Russia's state TV Channel One on Monday, holding up a sign behind the studio presenter. The sign read, "No war. Stop the war. Don't believe propaganda. They are lying to you here." Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked the protestor, who was identified as Marina Ovsyannikova, an editor at the channel.

123.title: What are the 3 questions Karnataka HC asked as it upheld hijab ban in colleges?
123.article_body: Karnataka High Court asked three questions and answered them as it upheld hijab ban in colleges. These questions were - whether wearing of hijab is an essential religious practice?, whether the prescription of school uniform is violative of rights?, and whether the Karnataka government order of February 5, apart from being incompetent and manifestly arbitrary, violates Articles 14 and 15?

124.title: Took 10-12 takes of hostel scene, couldn't do it: Khurshed on 'Munna Bhai...'
124.article_body: Khurshed Lawyer, who shared screen space with actor Sanjay Dutt in 'Munna Bhai MBBS', said he was unable to do hostel scene with the actor. "I had to keep poker face and stare at him without a smile...we must have done 10-12 retakes...because I kept laughing," he said, adding that Dutt told him to think that he is not around.

125.title: Over 16 lakh students to appear for SSC exam starting today in Maha
125.article_body: In all 16,39,172 students will appear for Maharashtra State Board's Secondary School Certificate (SSC) exams starting from Tuesday. The board has, however, warned students against late entry after question papers of Class 12 board exams were allegedly leaked on messaging apps. Reaching the exam centre late already makes a student suspect of any potential cheating case, a board official said.

126.title: Pig noises reveal their positive and negative emotions, find scientists
126.article_body: Scientists have created an algorithm using 7000 different types of sounds made by 411 pigs throughout their lifespan and found these sounds indicated their emotions. The study revealed that short sounds without much fluctuation in volume indicated positive emotions (happy or excited). Negative emotions (scared or stressed) were shown by longer squeals and vocalisations at higher frequencies.

127.title: Unidentified militant killed in encounter with security forces in Pulwama
127.article_body: An unidentified militant was killed during an encounter in the Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir, police said on Tuesday. The security forces launched a cordon and search operation in Charsoo area of Awantipora after receiving a specific input about the presence of militants. However, the operation turned into an encounter after the militants fired at the forces, police added.

128.title: Institutional discipline prevails: K'taka AG as HC upholds hijab ban
128.article_body: Karnataka Advocate General (AG) Prabhuling Navadgi on Tuesday reacted to the High Court upholding the hijab ban, saying, "Institutional discipline prevails over individual choice." This comes as the court dismissed petitions by Muslim students seeking permission to wear hijab in colleges. The judgment marks a "paradigm shift" in the interpretation of the Constitution's Article 25, Navadgi added.

129.title: 3 arrested for abducting, robbing jeweller of ₹2.5 cr in Tamil Nadu
129.article_body: The Madurai Police arrested three people for allegedly abducting and robbing a jeweller of ₹2.5 crore. According to police, the incident occurred on Sunday night when S Dharmaraj was on his way to Kanyakumari. However, two accused forcibly entered the car when jeweller's assistant and driver got down at Nesaneri Vilakku. The driver was also among those arrested, police added.

130.title: 'The Kashmir Files' to be screened for legislators of Karnataka Assembly today
130.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' is going to be screened for legislators of Karnataka Assembly, according to state Assembly Speaker Vishweshwar Hegde Kageri. The screening of the film has been organised at the Mantri Square Mall at screen number 6 on Tuesday evening, Kageri said. Chief Minister Basavaraj S Bommai on Sunday declared the film tax-free in the state.

131.title: Paytm shares tank another 8% after report on Paytm Payments Bank data leak
131.article_body: Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares tanked another 8% on Tuesday even as its CEO denied a report that claimed RBI barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers over data leak to Chinese entities. On Monday, the shares fell around 13%. "It is an absolutely malicious story...We have no server that is outside India," CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma clarified.

132.title: Max temp to touch 34 degrees Celsius in Delhi today, IMD predicts
132.article_body: Delhi is going to get slightly warmer on Tuesday as the maximum temperature will be 34 degrees Celsius, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast. The minimum temperature is set to be around 18 degrees Celsius. Apart from clear skies, Delhi’s air quality is likely to be in the 'moderate' category today, the Central Pollution Control Board predicted.

133.title: Multi-pronged strategy in place to eliminate child labour: Labour Minister
133.article_body: The Centre is pursuing a multi-pronged strategy to eliminate child labour and has taken comprehensive measures which include rehabilitation strategy, legislative action and providing the right to free education, Union Labour Minister Bhupender Yadav, said. The government is not maintaining centralised data of school-going children, who are involved as labourers with their families, Yadav added.

134.title: Man held for snatching Ex-Union Minister Vijay Goel's mobile phone in Delhi
134.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly snatching the mobile phone of former Union Minister and senior BJP leader Vijay Goel in Delhi. The accused has been identified as Sajan and had reportedly sold the phone for ₹2,200. Police said that a man had come near Goel's car on Monday and had run away with his phone.

135.title: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy to virtually address US Congress this week
135.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is set to address the US Congress this week in a bid to seek support amid Russia's attack on his country. He is scheduled to speak to members of the House and Senate in an event which will be livestreamed for the public. Notably, Zelenskyy delivered an address to the UK Parliament last week.

136.title: Tesla, SpaceX seeing significant recent inflation pressure: Musk
136.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said his firms are facing "significant inflationary pressure in raw materials and logistics". He also retweeted an article saying the Ukraine-Russia conflict sent commodity prices to their highest levels since 2008, saying his firms are "not alone". Tesla last week raised prices of some of its vehicles in China and US by $1,000.

137.title: 116 cattle died of poisoning after eating maize in Guj: State govt tells Assembly
137.article_body: As many as 116 cattle died due to poisoning in Gujarat's Sabarkantha district around two weeks ago, the state government informed the Assembly. Congress MLA Rajendrasinh Thakor claimed the cattle died after eating maize, which was stored for over 24 hours, causing the poisoning. Gujarat Cabinet minister said 114 cattle were saved as they received preliminary treatment on March 2.

138.title: Man arrested for Trinamool Congress councillor's murder in West Bengal
138.article_body: Police on Monday arrested a man in connection with the murder of Trinamool Congress (TMC) councillor Anupam Dutta, officials said. Dutta was allegedly shot in the head from close range while he was visiting a park on Panihati's North Station Road. "A firearm and mobile phone were seized from the arrested man," Barrackpore City Police Commissioner Manoj Verma said.

139.title: Ukraine's economy could shrink as much as 35% in 2022 if war continues: IMF
139.article_body:
Ukraine's economy may contract by 10% in 2022, assuming there's a "prompt
resolution of the war" with Russia, the International Monetary Fund said in a report. If the war continues, Ukraine's economy could shrink by 25% to 35%, the IMF added, citing wartime real GDP data from Iraq, other countries. Ukraine is set to experience a "deep recession", it stated.

140.title: What are some of the new rules for IPL 2022?
140.article_body: As per IPL 2022 match playing conditions, each team will be allowed two unsuccessful DRS requests in each innings. Upon catch dismissals, incoming batter will take strike in any case. If BCCI isn't able to reschedule a match due to a franchise not being able to field a team over COVID-19, it'll refer the issue to IPL Technical Committee.

141.title: High-level probe ordered: Govt on accidental firing of missile into Pakistan
141.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has issued a statement in Parliament on the accidental firing of missile into Pakistan. He said, "Government has taken it very seriously and official order for high-level probe has been given." He added, "I'd like to assure the House that our missile system is highly reliable and safe. Our safety procedure and protocols are high level."

142.title: My sister brought me back from death & gave me a second life: Rahul Roy
142.article_body: A year post suffering from brain stroke while shooting in Kargil, actor Rahul Roy said he's recovering well. Taking to Instagram, Rahul wrote, "My sister...@priyankaroy_pia takes care of everything. And most importantly my food...My daily diet is filled with everything organic and healthy." Rahul further said his sister brought him back from death and gave him a second life.

143.title: Hyd police find missing girl, hand her over to her grandmother
143.article_body: Hyderabad's LB Nagar Police Station on Monday tweeted that a three-year-old girl, who'd gone missing from her home, was found at a metro station after police received a dial 100 call at 7.30 pm on the same day. The girl has been handed over to her grandmother, it stated. The police station also shared a picture of the incident.

144.title: Ukraine's 'Russian Warship, Go F*** Yourself' postage stamp goes viral
144.article_body: Ukraine's 'Russian Warship, Go F*** Yourself' postage stamp has gone viral on social media. The stamp honours soldiers on Snake Island, who instead of surrendering told a Russian warship to "go f*** yourself". "The sketch by artist Boris Groh received the most votes and will soon be published by...postal company," Ukraine's First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Emine Dzheppar said.

145.title: Aus defeat WI in their 4th game to remain unbeaten in Women's WC 2022
145.article_body: Australia defeated West Indies by seven wickets to register their fourth win and remain unbeaten in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup 2022. Ellyse Perry picked three wickets while conceding 22 runs in her eight overs as Australia restricted WI to 131/10. Rachael Haynes then scored 83* off 95 balls to help her side win the match in 30.2 overs.

146.title: Russia's Medvedev to lose world no. 1 ranking 3 weeks after being crowned no. 1
146.article_body: Russian men's tennis player Daniil Medvedev will lose his world number one spot when the rankings will get updated on Monday (March 21). This comes after he crashed out of Indian Wells Masters after losing in round of 32 to Gaël Monfils 6-4, 3-6, 1-6. Medvedev was crowned world number one on February 28.

147.title: Assam and Meghalaya to sign pact to resolve border dispute on Mar 27 in Delhi
147.article_body: Assam and Meghalaya will sign an agreement in Delhi on March 27 to resolve the dispute in six border areas of both states, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said. "All cabinet colleagues and officials who're involved in this will be going to Delhi to mark this very important occasion and I'm hopeful March 27 will be a historic day," Sangma added.

148.title: Jailed journalist Fahad Shah booked under Jammu and Kashmir Public Safety Act
148.article_body: Journalist Fahad Shah has been booked under the Jammu and Kashmir Public Safety Act on Monday, over a month after police arrested him. The act allows the government to hold a person in custody without a trial for up to two years. Shah was arrested by the J&K Police in a third case after being granted bail by court twice.

149.title: Maintain peace by accepting order of HC: Pralhad Joshi on hijab verdict
149.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi welcomed the decision of Karnataka High Court on the hijab controversy and said "the basic work of students is to study". "I appeal to everyone that the state and country have to go forward, everyone has to maintain peace by accepting the order of HC," he added. Karnataka HC on Tuesday upheld hijab ban in colleges.

150.title: Man who stabbed Class 10 girl at school in Pune attempts suicide
150.article_body: A 21-year-old man who's accused of stabbing a Class 10 girl at her school farewell in Pune, later allegedly attempted suicide by consuming a poisonous substance, police said on Monday. The accused is unconscious and undergoing treatment at a hospital, a senior inspector said. The girl is stable and has been kept under observation, DCP (Zone 4) Rohidas Pawar said.

151.title: I essayed the role of tree in school plays; never got the main role: Ananya
151.article_body: Ananya Panday said she was in the background in her school plays and essayed the role of a tree, standing with her arms raised. "I'd audition but never land the main role," she added. When asked about this transiting from being in...background to being the lead actress, Ananya said, "I'm just happy that I get to be an actor."

152.title: 75% of Punjab MLAs are crorepatis, AAP's Kulwant Singh richest with ₹238-cr assets
152.article_body: The new Punjab Assembly has nearly 75% MLAs who are crorepatis, according to a report by the Association for Democratic Reforms and the Punjab Election Watch. AAP has 63 MLAs who are crorepatis including the richest Kulwant Singh who declared ₹238-crore assets. Congress has 17 crorepati MLAs, SAD has three, BJP has two, BSP has one and one is Independent.

153.title: Over 28 lakh people fled Ukraine since Russia attack: UN
153.article_body: Over 28 lakh people have fled Ukraine since Russia attacked the country, said the United Nations on Monday, making it Europe's biggest refugee crisis since World War II. European Union officials have estimated that the number of refugees could reach 50 lakh, while some have predicted the figure to be higher. Lakhs of people have reportedly been displaced within Ukraine.

154.title: Pant will become India's highest-scoring wicketkeeper in Tests: Irfan Pathan
154.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant over his performance in the Sri Lanka Tests, Irfan Pathan said the 24-year-old will end his career as India's highest run-scoring wicketkeeper-batter in Test cricket. "At such a young age, so much improvement has been seen in his cricket," added Irfan. Pant scored 96, 39 and 50 runs in the two Tests against Sri Lanka.

155.title: Real normalcy in J&K after abrogation of Article 370: Nirmala Sitharaman
155.article_body: There has been a "fake normalcy" in Jammu and Kashmir since Independence under the garb of Article 370 and after its abrogation, now there is real normalcy there, Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. "How can we say there was normalcy in Kashmir earlier when the Constitution of India was not applicable there?" Sitharaman added.

156.title: SC questions pension for Kerala ministers' staff after 2yrs service
156.article_body: Supreme Court, while taking note of an Indian Express report, has criticised Kerala government's policy of giving "life-long" pensions to state ministers' staff after only two years of service. The court was hearing a plea by Kerala transport corporation against state-owned companies' high fuel prices. "If you've...money for [pensions], why are you here for this?" it said for the plea.

157.title: Wearing hijab not an essential religious practice, says Karnataka HC as it upholds hijab ban
157.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Tuesday dismissed writ petitions filed by Muslim girl students seeking permission to wear hijab in colleges. The court held prescription of uniform as a reasonable restriction, saying that wearing of hijab is not an essential religious practice of the Islamic faith. Notably, Section 144 of CrPC is imposed in many parts of Karnataka till March 21.

158.title: Have uniformity, don't involve politics in remission cases: SC to UP govt
158.article_body: Supreme Court told the Uttar Pradesh government to not involve politics in remission cases and maintain uniformity. "We are coming across cases specifically from UP where no yardsticks are followed...Somebody goes out after nine years while others are incarcerated for more than 20 years," it added. "Follow one standard...And those standards must be followed in all cases," SC stated.

159.title: He's always ready to help: Abhimanyu on working with Akshay Kumar
159.article_body: Actor Abhimanyu Singh, speaking about working with Akshay Kumar in the upcoming film 'Bachchhan Paandey', said, "It's always fun to work with him." "He makes you feel very comfortable...[He's] always ready to help you on the set and off the set," he added. "Also, his one-liners are so funny most of the time that you can never forget," Abhimanyu said.

160.title: Poll results never surprised me, Cong going downhill since 2014: Sibal
160.article_body: Days after the election results were announced in five states, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the results "never surprised" him. "We have been going downhill since 2014. We have lost state after state...In the meantime, there has been an exodus of some key people...those who had the confidence of the leadership...moving away from the Congress," Kapil added.

161.title: Never visualised our morality going so low: SC on misuse of COVID death aid
161.article_body: The Supreme Court hinted at directing a CAG probe over the misuse of its order and people getting COVID death compensation of ₹50,000 on the basis of fake documents issued by doctors. "We never visualised that our morality can go so low that these kinds of fake claims would be made...never thought this scheme could be misused," the court said.

162.title: US-based inFeedo, founded by 2 Indians, raises $12 million
162.article_body: US-based employee experience platform ﻿inFeedo﻿ has raised $12 million in funding from Jungle Ventures and Tiger Global. Other investors who participated in the funding included Bling Capital, Zeta Founder Bhavin Turakhia, Gainsight Co-founder Sreedhar Peddineni, Freshworks CHRO Suman Gopalan and Ankur Warikoo. The startup was founded by two Indians Tanmaya Jain and Varun Puri.

163.title: Domestic air passenger traffic nears pre-COVID-19 level: Scindia in Parliament
163.article_body: After suffering huge losses, the civil aviation industry is close to reaching pre-COVID-19 pandemic level as traffic of 3,80,000 passengers per day was recorded in December 2021, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia told the Rajya Sabha. Responding to a question by Shiv Sena MP Anil Desai, Scindia said that the domestic traffic was close to about 4,00,000 passengers before the pandemic.

164.title: Wouldn't believe I'd get paired with Deepika, I come from nowhere: Siddhant
164.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, who was last seen with actress Deepika Padukone in 'Gehraiyaan', said that if someone had told him he would be paired with the actress in a film, he wouldn't have believed it. "I come from nowhere. Chuck pebble in dark in movie theatre and person it hits would be me, less than ten years ago," Siddhant added.

165.title: Taunts over loss in Odisha rural polls makes woman attempt suicide, husband dies
165.article_body: A man allegedly hanged himself to death in Odisha's Basudevpur after his wife consumed insecticide following a fight between the couple following alleged taunts over her loss in the panchayat elections. According to the police, the man had an argument with supporters of the winning candidate. Later, a fight broke out between the couple, after which she consumed insecticide.

166.title: War will likely be over by early May, Russia will run out of resources: Ukraine
166.article_body: Oleksiy Arestovich, an adviser to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's chief of staff, has said that the war in Ukraine is likely to be over by early May when Russia runs out of resources. Talks between Ukraine and Russia have so far produced very few results other than several humanitarian corridors. The war in Ukraine began on February 24.

167.title: Twin towers in Noida to be demolished in 9 seconds using over 2,500 kg explosives
167.article_body: Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in Noida's Sector 93A will be demolished within nine seconds, according to Edifice Engineering, the firm planning the demolition. Holes will be drilled into the towers' columns to place the explosives. Around 2,500-4,000 kilograms of explosives could be required, an official said. "Loading the structure with the explosives can take 12-15 days," the official added.

168.title: Strategy formulated to promote medical tourism in India: G Kishan Reddy
168.article_body: Union Minister for Tourism G Kishan Reddy said government has formed a strategy for promoting India as a medical and wellness tourism destination. A National Medical and Wellness Tourism Board has been formed for the implementation of the roadmap, the minister said while replying to a question in Lok Sabha. E-Medical visas have been introduced for 156 countries, he added.

169.title: 30-yr-old Guj man objects to harassment of mentally unstable man, killed
169.article_body: A 30-year-old man, Amit Rathod, from Gujarat's Ahmedabad was killed by four men after he objected to harassment of a mentally unstable man. The four accused have been arrested by the police. They have been identified as Naresh Gathiyo, Ramesh Makkhi, Gautam Chavda and Jay Chino. FIR said that Rathod died after being stabbed multiple times by the accused.

170.title: Delhi to get 100 more e-vehicle charging stations by June 27
170.article_body: Hundred new e-vehicle charging stations with 500 charging points will be set up across "prime locations" in Delhi by June 27, Power Minister Satyendar Jain said. Of the 100 stations, 71 will be built in parking lots and premises of metro stations, he added. Jain further said that the charge for using the station facility would be "₹2 per unit".

171.title: Amazon accuses Future Retail, Reliance Industries of 'fraud' in newspaper ads
171.article_body: Amazon on Tuesday took out ads in newspapers, accusing Future Retail and Reliance Industries of "fraud" after Reliance took over several Future stores. Amazon and Future are currently engaged in a legal battle over the ₹24,713-crore Future-Reliance deal. In the ads, Amazon said, "These actions have been done in a clandestine manner by playing a fraud on...constitutional courts in India."

172.title: UAPA accused Ishrat Jahan gets bail in Delhi riots conspiracy case
172.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday granted bail to former Congress councillor Ishrat Jahan in connection with 2020 Northeast Delhi riots conspiracy case. She was accused under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA). She was neither physically present in Northeast Delhi for riots nor was she part of any group, the court stated. Jahan was earlier granted bail in another case.

173.title: Video of Aaradhya's speech in Hindi goes viral, dad Abhishek Bachchan reacts
