UV Creations, the production house behind the period romantic drama, shared the news on Monday, writing on Twitter, "A phenomenal response for #RadheShyam with ₹151 crore gross in three days worldwide. #BlockBusterRadheShyam."

348.title: Misplaced pass, 'savage' Go First employee said 'Catch next flight': Babil
348.article_body: Actor Babil took to Instagram Stories to share that he was told to "go catch the next flight" by a Go First, formerly known as GoAir, employee after the actor told him that he had misplaced his boarding pass. "I know GoAir has rude staff reputation but...that is not rude that is savage," Babil wrote.

349.title: 3.5 million children in Afghanistan need nutritious treatment: WFP
349.article_body: United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) has said that 3.5 million children in Afghanistan currently need nutritious treatment. UNICEF had earlier said that half of the Afghan children aged below five will be exposed to acute malnutrition in 2022. Afghanistan has been experiencing food shortages amid an economic crisis triggered after the Taliban seized power in the country last year.

350.title: Ravichandran Ashwin becomes 8th highest wicket-taker in Test cricket history
350.article_body: Team India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has become the eighth-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket history. After dismissing Dhananjaya de Silva in Sri Lanka's second innings in the Day-Night Test, Ashwin took his tally of Test wickets to 440, overtaking Dale Steyn's tally of 439 wickets. Ex-West Indies pacer Courtney Walsh is the seventh-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket with 519 scalps.

351.title: What is the Mumbai Climate Action Plan all about?
351.article_body: The Mumbai Climate Action Plan announced by the Maharashtra government on Sunday aims towards zero emission of greenhouse gas or a net-zero target for 2050. Mumbai's target puts it two decades ahead of India's national goal of cutting its emissions to net-zero by 2070. It proposes large-scale changes on priority across six strategic areas.

352.title: Hindi remake of Tamil action thriller 'Aaranya Kaandam' in the works
352.article_body: Producers Ramesh Taurani and Akshai Puri have acquired rights to the Tamil neo-noir action thriller 'Aaranya Kaandam'. It will be directed by Ajay Bahl, who has helmed films like 'Section 375' and 'B.A. Pass'. The film follows a day in the lives of six characters, played by Jackie Shroff, Ravi Krishna, Sampath Raj, Yasmin Ponnappa, Guru Somasundaram and Master Vasanth.

353.title: Fifty vs Pak was easy, but century vs WI came at risky situation: Mandhana
353.article_body: Talking about her performance in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said her century against WI is a special one as it came when team was in a "risky situation". "The first one [52-run knock against Pakistan] was achieved in easy circumstances," she added. In India's three matches, Mandhana has scored 52, 6, 123 runs.

354.title: Make 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in Rajasthan: Cong MLA
354.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA Bhanwar Lal Sharma has urged the Congress-led state government to make 'The Kashmir Files' a tax-free movie in the state. Sharma added that he "will write a letter to CM Ashok Gehlot" for the same. The movie has already been made tax-free by the governments of Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Haryana.

355.title: Putin is frustrated with progress of Russian forces in Ukraine: US
355.article_body: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is frustrated that his forces are not making the kind of progress that he thought they would make in Ukraine, including in Kyiv. Sullivan added that for this reason, Putin is expanding the number of targets and trying to cause damage in every part of the country.

356.title: PM greeted with 'Modi, Modi' chants in Parliament after state poll wins
356.article_body: PM Narendra Modi was greeted by 'Modi, Modi' chants as he entered the Parliament to attend the second half of the Budget session as it resumed today. BJP MPs and Union Ministers were seen chanting PM's name and thumping the desks as the latter took his seat in the Lok Sabha. BJP emerged victorious in UP, Uttarakhand, Manipur and Goa.

357.title: Completely false: Paytm Payments Bank on report of leaking data to Chinese firms
357.article_body: Paytm Payments Bank denied a report that claimed that it was punished by the RBI for allegedly sharing information with China-based entities that indirectly own a stake in Paytm Payments Bank. "The report is completely false and simply sensationalising," the company said. Notably, China's Alibaba Group Holding and its affiliate, Jack Ma's Ant Group, own shares of Paytm.

358.title: Medical supplies continue to reach war-torn Ukraine: WHO
358.article_body: The WHO has said that the medical supplies including trauma kits, oxygen generators and drugs continue to reach Ukraine, which is under attack by Russian forces. "The coming days and weeks will see a constant flow of medical supplies," it said. It admitted that supply chains have been disrupted and that hospitals are struggling to cater to the patients.

359.title: His frustration is being seen on ground: Irfan on lack of runs from Kohli
359.article_body: Irfan Pathan has said Virat Kohli's frustration due to lack of runs from him is being seen on the ground. "Mistakes we are seeing from Kohli, we didn't use to see them earlier," he added. Following Kohli's 23 and 13 in ongoing second Test against Sri Lanka, his average slipped below fifty in Test cricket for first time since 2017.

360.title: Portion of balcony collapses in Delhi's Anand Parbat area, 4 injured
360.article_body: As many as four people were injured after a portion of their balcony collapsed in Delhi. The incident took place in the Anand Parbat area of the national capital on Sunday night. Reports said that officials of the Delhi Fire Service rushed to the spot and gave details about the incident.

361.title: My Ferrari can't go through: UK singer as he fills potholes near his house
361.article_body: Britain's 77-year-old singer Rod Stewart filled potholes on a road near his house in Harlow, Essex. In an Instagram video that showed him filling potholes, Stewart said, "People are bashing their cars up. The other day, there was an ambulance with a burst tyre. My Ferrari can't go through here at all." He added, "It's been like this for ages."

362.title: Indian Army constructs 2 houses within 4 weeks using 3D printing technology in Guj
362.article_body: The Indian Army's Military Engineering Services has constructed two houses in South Western Air Command in Gujarat's Gandhinagar within four weeks using 3D rapid construction technology, an official release said. Officials claim the houses are first-of-its-kind structures in India. Each house has a built area of around 700 square feet and is in compliance with Zone-3 earthquake specifications.

363.title: Andrea Bocelli's son to team up with Sukriti & Prakriti for a song: Report
363.article_body: Italian opera singer Andrea Bocelli's son Matteo is set to collaborate with singers, Prakriti Kakar and Sukriti Kakar, for a song, according to a report. "The single will be a classic east meets west collaborative effort and will embrace a lot of futuristic and experimental fusion soundscapes," a source told Pinkvilla. Matteo is expected to arrive in India this month.

364.title: Big B ensured we rehearsed thrice even for 1-2 lines: Maha official on 'Jhund'
364.article_body: Maharashtra state surveillance officer Dr Pradeep Awate, who shared screen space with actor Amitabh Bachchan in 'Jhund' said that Amitabh would ensure that rehearsals for a scene happened at least thrice even if it was one or two lines. "Despite his stature and experience as an actor, Amitabhji took the effort to ensure a perfect shot," Dr Awate said.

365.title: I am pretty surprised to see where he was standing: Karthik on Kohli's dismissal
365.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli getting LBW out for 13 runs in the second innings of the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, Dinesh Karthik said, "I am pretty surprised to see where he was standing in the crease." Karthik added, "He was standing much outside leg stump." Karthik further suggested that Kohli should have been standing on middle and leg stump.

366.title: Bengaluru man sues restaurant for 40 paise overcharge, fined ₹4,000
366.article_body: A consumer court ordered a Bengaluru senior citizen to pay ₹4,000 in compensation to a restaurant, Hotel Empire, after the former filed a lawsuit alleging that the restaurant had overcharged him by 40 paise. The judges ordered the petitioner, Murthy, to pay the compensation to the restaurant and stated that Murthy was "wasting the court's time for publicity".

367.title: Billionaire Founder of S Korean internet firm Kakao quits board
367.article_body: Brian Kim, the billionaire Founder of South Korea's leading chat app operator Kakao, has stepped down from the company's board. The development comes after reports claimed police were probing allegations that Kim evaded nearly $740 million taxes in 2014. Recently, the company was also criticised over sale of stock by top executives after a Kakao unit's successful stock market debut.

368.title: Nadal favourite to potentially win the Roland Garros 2022: Murray
368.article_body: British tennis player Andy Murray said that Rafael Nadal is the favourite to potentially win the Roland Garros 2022. Murray added Nadal has less pressure than the last couple of French Opens due to his good start to the year. In the ongoing season, Nadal has won three titles, including the Australian Open 2022, and is 16-0.

369.title: CBSE forms panel after complaints of wrong answer key in Class 10 Odia exam
369.article_body: CBSE has decided to constitute an expert committee after it received complaints from a school that the answer key of the Odia Language paper in the Term-1 Class 10 board exams was fractionally "wrong". CBSE further said, "An appropriate decision will be taken by the Board within 24 hours, on the basis of the report of the expert committee."

370.title: Pant is best wicketkeeper in terms of having impact on game: Parthiv
370.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel said Rishabh Pant has consistently improved his wicketkeeping. He added Pant is among the top three Indian wicketkeepers in terms of batting ability. "If it's about having...impact on...game, then Pant is currently the best wicketkeeper," Parthiv stated. Pant scored the fastest fifty by an Indian in Test cricket in the Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka.

371.title: SP ally RLD dissolves all its units, frontals in Uttar Pradesh
371.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) announced to "dissolve" its units (state, regional and district) and frontals in Uttar Pradesh "with immediate effect" on Monday. The party said that the directions for this order have been given by its national president Jayant Chaudhary. RLD contested the recent UP state Assembly elections in an alliance with the Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party.

372.title: Chennai Metro opens 2 new stations in phase-1 extension stretch
372.article_body: Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) opened the Tiruvottiyur Theradi and Wimco Nagar Depot stations in phase-1 extension between Washermanpet and Wimco Nagar on Sunday. Commuters will also be able to park their vehicles at Wimco Nagar metro station free of charge till March 31, CMRL said. Phase-1 metro line consists of two corridors, Washermanpet-Chennai Airport and Chennai Central-St Thomas Mount.

373.title: Was ragged in school, was told 'Your dad wears sunglasses at night': Bappi's son
373.article_body: Late musician Bappi Lahiri's son Bappa Lahiri in an interview revealed that he used to get ragged in school because of his father's sunglasses. "People said, 'Oh, your father wears sunglasses at night, he can't see etc'," he added. "Today it's become like a trend. He never went by the book when it came to style," Bappa further said.

374.title: Meta prohibits calls for death of a head of state amid Russia-Ukraine war
374.article_body: Meta clarified on Sunday that it's not allowing posts calling for the death of a head of state in context of Russian invasion of Ukraine, Reuters reported citing President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg. This comes after Meta allowed some posts seeking the death of Russian President Vladimir Putin. "We are not condoning violence against Russians in general," Clegg wrote.

375.title: Clash between SP and BJP supporters leads to stone-pelting in UP; 10 booked
375.article_body: A political argument between supporters of Samajwadi Party and BJP led to a clash and stone-pelting in Uttar Pradesh, police said. According to police, an FIR was registered against 10 persons and three of them were detained in this connection. "Four police teams were rushed to the spot to contain the situation. Those involved...managed to escape," a police officer said.

376.title: Take responsibility for Uttarakhand defeat, apologised to members: Harish
376.article_body: Congress leader and former Uttarakhand Chief Minister Harish Rawat said that he takes responsibility for Congress' defeat in the Uttarakhand Assembly elections. "All of us thought that we were winning in Uttarakhand...I apologised to every member and leadership in the working committee. I have also apologised to the public before," Rawat said.

377.title: British Academy Film Awards pay tribute to Lata Mangeshkar in 'In Memoriam'
377.article_body: The late singer Lata Mangeshkar was featured in the 'In Memoriam' segment at the 2022 edition of the British Academy of Film and Television Awards. The tribute described her as "an Indian playback singer, who recorded an estimated 25,000 songs for more than 1,000 Hindi films over a career spanning 70 years". She passed away aged 92 on February 6.

378.title: Cong leaders don't have courage to make party Gandhi-mukt: BJP MP
378.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi has taken a dig at the Congress by saying that "Congress leaders don't have the courage to make their party Gandhi-mukt". "Drowned in corruption and dynastic politics, Congress has been pretending to brainstorm for the past many years," Modi said in a reference to Congress' defeat in the recent five state Assembly elections.

379.title: Sensex ends 935 points higher at 56,486, Nifty settles at 16,871
379.article_body: The Sensex on Monday climbed 935 points or 1.68% to settle at 56,486, while Nifty 50 jumped 241 points or 1.45% higher to close at 16,871. While Infosys was the top Nifty gainer as it rose close to 4%, Paytm shares fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE on Monday.

380.title: Not a VIP, won't be given special facilities in jail: Court denies home food for Chitra
380.article_body: A Delhi court remarked that former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is "not a VIP" and won't be provided special facilities during her 14-day judicial custody. Denying her home-cooked food, it said, "There are inmates who are in their 70s, who eat Tihar jail food. I have myself eaten Tihar...food. It’s good...VIP prisoners want everything...Every accused, every prisoner is the same."

381.title: 2 dead after shell hits residential building in Ukraine: Official
381.article_body: At least two people have died and three were hospitalised after a shell hit a nine-storey residential building in Ukraine's Kyiv on Monday, Internal Affairs adviser Anton Gerashchenko said. The fire was extinguished at 7.58 am, emergency services said. This comes as Ukraine's Deputy PM announced that they'll try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors the same day.

382.title: Excited to get started with MI, looks very close-knit team: Archer
382.article_body: England pacer Jofra Archer, who was bought by MI for ₹8 crore in the IPL mega auction, has said he's really excited to get started with the franchise. "MI looks very close-knit and family-oriented and such teams always do well," he stated. Archer is likely to miss the upcoming season and feature for the franchise in IPL 2023.

383.title: 15-year-old girl gang-raped near Ahmedabad, 8 men arrested
383.article_body: Eight men were arrested on Sunday for allegedly abducting and raping a 15-year-old girl on the outskirts of Ahmedabad. According to police, the girl was brought to a secluded area by the main accused, where he had also called seven of his friends. She was then taken near a boring well where the eight men forced themselves upon her.

384.title: NASA shares pic of infant star's energetic outburst, says 'A star is born'
384.article_body: NASA has shared the picture of an energetic outburst from an infant star captured by the Hubble Space Telescope. Sharing the picture on Twitter, NASA tweeted, "A star is born." NASA explained, "This stellar tantrum, produced by an extremely young star in the earliest phase of formation, consists of an incandescent jet of gas travelling at supersonic speeds."

385.title: Singer Kanika Kapoor to get married second time in May: Report
385.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor, known for her song 'Baby Doll', will be getting married to NRI businessman Gautam in May, reported ETimes. This will be the singer's second marriage. She was earlier married to NRI businessman Raj Chandok and got divorced in 2012. Kanika and Gautam have reportedly been dating for a year and their wedding will take place in London.

386.title: No COVID-19 death reported in Navi Mumbai in March so far
386.article_body: No COVID-19 death was reported in the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) in March so far. The civic body saw death due to COVID-19 last time on February 26. The city has so far reported 2,049 COVID-19 deaths, of which around 75 deaths were reported during the third wave of the pandemic.

387.title: Pant and Dhoni will stand out as India's greatest wicketkeepers: Karthik
387.article_body: Dinesh Karthik has said Rishabh Pant is on his way to greatness after the India wicketkeeper-batter  broke Kapil Dev's 40-year-old record (30-ball 50) to become the fastest half-centurion (28-ball 50) for India in Tests. He added that if Pant has a full-fledged wicketkeeping career then he and Dhoni will stand out as India's greatest wicketkeepers to have played the game.

388.title: AAP has enough experience to run Punjab govt: Bhagwant Mann
388.article_body: Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann on Monday said AAP has enough experience to run the Punjab government. "We know how to run the administration. I have been a member of [Lok Sabha] for seven years," Mann said. He added, "Many veteran politicians have lost the elections and new people have won...There'll be out of the box thinking in this government."

389.title: KTR inaugurates data sciences company Gramener's new office in Hyd
389.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday inaugurated the new office of data sciences company Gramener in Hyderabad. The New Jersey-based company's Hyderabad office will have the capacity to aid enterprises with over 250 data science resources, the Telangana government has said. "Data sciences...is hugely underrated [right now] in a country like India," KTR said at the ceremony.

390.title: India improves in Maternal Mortality Ratio, on track to achieve 2030 goal: Govt
390.article_body: India made a significant improvement in Maternal Mortality Ratio as the number of deaths per lakh childbirths declined from 113 in 2016-18 to 103 in 2017-19, said the government. The country is on track to achieve the National Health Policy (NHP) target of 100/lakh live births by 2020 and the SDG target of 70/lakh live births by 2030, it added.

391.title: BJP lied about support to displaced Kashmiri Pandit families: Kerala Cong
391.article_body: Kerala Congress said BJP lied about government support to displaced [Kashmiri] Pandit families & claimed credit for Congress government's initiatives. "UPA government gave jobs to 15,000 Pandits, recruited 6,000 Pandits in J&K government," party's tweet read. "Pandits' migration started...in January 1990. BJP did nothing and continued supporting VP Singh till November 1990," another tweet said.

392.title: Actress Rebel Wilson flashes middle finger at Putin during BAFTA Awards
392.article_body: Australian actress Rebel Wilson flashed her middle finger at Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine while hosting the BAFTA Film Awards 2022. "This is the gesture for Putin," the 42-year-old actress said, flipping her middle finger as she spoke. BAFTA's Twitter handle shared her video and tweeted, "Here's a lesson in sign language from Rebel Wilson."

393.title: Gang of robbers arrested after gunfight in Delhi's Seemapuri
393.article_body: A gang of robbers was arrested by Delhi Police on Saturday following a gunfight in Delhi's Seemapuri area. Police confiscated two stolen bicycles, one pistol, three revolvers, 37 live ammunition, pepper spray and hammers from the gang. Two of the four accused were shot after police received a tip-off and laid a trap to nab them.

394.title: Vicky wins Performance of Year, Akshay wins Person of Year at Hello Hall of Fame Awards
394.article_body: Vicky Kaushal was awarded for Performance of the Year and Akshay Kumar was named Person of the Year at the HELLO! Hall Of Fame Awards 2022. Kiara Advani won the Best Actor Critic's Choice award. Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon won for Best Actor Popular Choice male and female respectively. Veteran actress Rekha was honoured with the Cinematic Legend award.

395.title: B'luru city bus pass to be available online, can be booked via app
395.article_body: The passes for the Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) will be available online and can be booked via the mobile application Tummoc. All electronic payments, including QR codes, will be accepted for the purchase of passes. At present, passengers have to visit Traffic Transit Management Centres (TTMCs) and bus stations to obtain the passes.

396.title: Aus, Netherlands start legal action against Russia over MH17 downing
396.article_body: Australia and Netherlands said that they've started legal action against Russia at International Civil Aviation Organization over downing of Malaysian Airlines flight MH17 in July 2014. "Death of 298 civilians...can't...remain without consequences," Dutch Minister Wopke Hoekstra said. The Kuala Lumpur-bound plane was hit over rebel-held eastern Ukraine by what was deemed to be a Russian missile.

397.title: Police personnel in Madhya Pradesh to get leave to watch 'The Kashmir Files'
397.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Monday said he has informed the DGP to grant leave for one day to all police personnel in the state to watch Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', whenever they choose to do so with their families. This comes after CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday declared 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the state.

398.title: 10 humanitarian corridors to operate today: Ukraine Deputy PM
398.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk has said that the country will try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors that have been agreed upon for today. She added that civilians in towns near Kyiv and in eastern Luhansk will be able to use them. Earlier, Ukraine President said that 1.25 lakh people have been evacuated via humanitarian corridors.

399.title: Ukraine finish second behind China in 2022 Winter Paralympic medal count
399.article_body: Ukraine finished second in the 2022 Winter Paralympics in Beijing. Ukraine won 11 gold medals, 10 silver medals and eight bronze medals. China finished first with 18 gold medals and a total of 61 medals. Ukrainian athletes were the last delegation to arrive in Beijing because of logistical challenges caused by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

400.title: Rishabh Pant has backed his strengths, he's learning: Jasprit Bumrah
400.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah said the team will help Rishabh Pant go forward with the tempo he likes to play at. "You can't teach everyone to play in the same manner. Pant has backed his strengths...he's [also] learning a lot and getting experience," he added. Pant smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in the ongoing Sri Lanka Test.
